name: tolerate
trans: to accept behavior and beliefs that are different from your own, although you may not agree with or approve of them

name: indiscernible
trans: impossible to see, see clearly, or understand

name: maneuver
trans: a planned action that is intended to obtain an advantage

name: focus
trans: the main object or interest, or the attention given something

name: indistinct
trans: not clear

name: blur
trans: something whose shape is not clear

name: unconsciously
trans: without awareness

name: peripheral
trans: not central or of main importance

name: vision
trans: the ability to see

name: athlete
trans: a person who is trained or skilled in a sport and esp. one who regularly competes with others in organized events

name: demonstrate
trans: to show how to do something; explain

name: range
trans: the level to which something is limited, or the area within which something operates

name: performance
trans: the act of doing something, such as your job

name: detect
trans: to notice something that is partly hidden or not clear or to discover something, esp. using a special method

name: distracting
trans: to cause to turn one's attention away from something

name: anticipate
trans: to imagine or expect that something will happen, sometimes taking action in preparation for it

name: scan
trans: to examine something carefully

name: complicate
trans: to make something more difficult to deal with or do

name: coordinate
trans: to make various, separate things work together

name: boundary
trans: an edge or limit of something
